repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.unittitle: Gender and Sexuality Resource Center Records
did.abstract: This collections consists of programs and advertisements created by the Gender and Sexuality Resource Center, an institution that acts to create a safe environment for students of various sexual orientations.
did.physloc: Materials are located onsite in the department.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged in the order it was received in.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Gender and Sexuality Resource Center (GSRC) is a group based in the campus center. There is a director of the center who is aided by departamental liasons across the Uptown and Downtown Campuses. These people are faculty and staff who are available to assist LGBTQ students with any campus related problems. The GSRC also hosted many events in tandem with LGBTQ student groups including a Second Chance Prom and Safe Space Training sessions.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unresticted.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.
The University Archives are eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by the Gender and Sexuality Resource Center.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, The Gender and Sexuality Resource Center, 2004-2013. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Gender and Sexuality Resource Center).

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections was processed in 2017 by Erik Stolarski

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection holds materials related to events hosted by the Gender and Sexuality Resource Center (GSRC) in tandem with various student groups at the University at Albany. The majority pertains to the Safe Space Training sessions that were hosted by the GSRC and open to student and faculty and staff. These include programs, advertisements, workbooks, and other ephemera from these events. Programs and pamphlets from other Safe Space training sessions at Mohawk Valley Community College and Hudson Valley Community College are included as they molded their programs after University at Albanyâ€™s. This collection also includes programs for a Camp Pride a week long summer camp devoted to helping young LGBTQ students learn about their sexuality. The last part of this collection is three banners created by the GSRC as advertisements for their campus-wide events such as Second Chance Prom.
